learning.supervised.interfaces

Interface DistMatrixUserInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdaBoostM2, AKNN, ANHBNN, CBWkNN, DBScan, DWHFNN, DWHFNNBoostable, GHPC, GHPKM, GKH, HFNN, HFNNBoostable, HIKNN, HIKNNBoostable, HIKNNNonDW, HwKNN, HwKNNBoostable, KernelGHPKM, LHPC, LKH, NHBNN, NWKNN, RRKNN

    public interface DistMatrixUserInterface
    This interface declares the getters and setters for the upper triangular float distance matrix. It can be used by classifiers and clusterers to request a distance matrix from the evaluation environment, which calculates it once for all the algorithms, if distance matrix users are present.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float[][] getDistMatrix()
      Distance matrix getter.
      void setDistMatrix(float[][] distMatrix)
      Distance matrix setter.

    • Method Detail

      • setDistMatrix

        void setDistMatrix(float[][] distMatrix)
        Distance matrix setter.
        Parameters:
        distMatrix - float[][] representing the upper triangular distance matrix. Each row i contains only entries for j > i, due to distances being symmetric. For compression, the zeroed lower triangular entries are not stored, so each row i contains (size - i - 1) elements. The entry in distMatrix[i][j] corresponds to the distance between data points i and i + j + 1.

      • getDistMatrix

        float[][] getDistMatrix()
        Distance matrix getter.
        Returns:
        float[][] representing the upper triangular distance matrix. Each row i contains only entries for j > i, due to distances being symmetric. For compression, the zeroed lower triangular entries are not stored, so each row i contains (size - i - 1) elements. The entry in distMatrix[i][j] corresponds to the distance between data points i and i + j + 1.
